['Here are several words and phrases related to the concept of rummaging:', 'Sift - To search for something carefully through a large amount of something else.', 'Forage - Search widely for food or provisions.', 'Scavenge - Search for and steal whatever is usable from discarded waste.', 'Comb - Thoroughly search an area in order to find something.', 'Ransack - Rob a place violently and hurriedly, typically taking anything that seems of value.', 'Paw through - To rummage or sift through something with the hands.', 'Delve into - Search persistently and thoroughly for information about a subject.', 'Trawl - Conduct an extensive search in a particular area or field.', 'Go over - Examine carefully, often to find mistakes or points that need improvement.', 'Scour - Painstakingly search for something.', 'Skim through - To read or look through rapidly without going into detail.', 'Search high and low - To seek in all places possible where an item might be found.', 'Probe - Examine thoroughly, especially to discover the facts of a matter or situation.', 'Rifle (through something) - Go through quickly but carelessly; rummage.', "Dredge up - Search for and find things that are difficult to locate or bring up from one's memory.", 'Dig into – To start searching a new place with determination', 'Sift out – Remove unwanted elements by careful examination.', 'Mine through (information) - Explore information exhaustively, typically to find facts or details.', 'Raid the pantry/fridge - To search quickly for something to eat.', 'Rummage sale - An event where people sell unwanted items by rummaging.']
